Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: RESULTS : Verapamil significantly increased PRL levels in healthy controls ( N . 8 , PRL : 183 % ) , macroprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 7 % ) , microprolactinoma ( N . 19 , PRL : 21 % ) , macroprolactinemia ( N . 23 , PRL : 126 % ) , but not in pseudoprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 0 . 8 % ) , and risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia ( N . 7 , PRL : 3 % ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| healthy controls |
| macroprolactinoma |
| microprolactinoma |
| macroprolactinemia |
| pseudoprolactinoma |
| risperidone-induced hyperprolactinemia |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| macroprolactinoma |
| microprolactinoma |
| macroprolactinemia |
| pseudoprolactinoma |

Note: "healthy controls" is not a disease, it refers to a group of individuals without the disease under investigation.

"risperidone-induced hyperprolactinemia" is a valid disease entity, it refers to an increase in prolactin levels caused by the use of the medication risperidone.
